body:
>  Windows: putting spaces where they don't belong since Windows NT 3.1.

Purely out of interest: Windows uses the Scope ID of the network interface in question as the zone identifier. This is a `long`, so zones typically have the value `%1`, `%2`, etc.

Using the network interface name on Windows [seems to be a Go thing](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/ceeb52d86214757b25a39a939fe945eb8e787bf6/src/net/lookup_windows.go#L132). Presumably there's good reason, although it does make taking URLs formatted by Go and parsing them in other languages slightly tricky.
